summary: radamel falcao 's former monaco team-mate nabil dirar believes the colombian must be regretting his failed loan move to manchester united even though he was not happy in france . the former atletico madrid striker has struggled to reach the heights he achieved before suffering a serious knee injury . united will have to pay # 46million to make falcao 's transfer permanent .

explain: Radamel Falcao did not perform well while playing for Manchester United on loan. He struggled both in terms of his physical performance and his ability to integrate into the team, leading many to question whether remaining at the club would be in his best interests.
Nabil Dirar, Falcao's former teammate at Monaco, believes that Falcao might be regretting his decision to join Manchester United on loan.

The aspect states that Falcao was not happy in France, but he needed more atmosphere to perform well. This means that Falcao was not content with his time at Monaco, but he would have been more motivated and productive in a more competitive and high-pressure environment. Instead, he struggled to find his form at United due to injury and lack of playing time, which ultimately led to his failed loan move. The fact that United will have to pay Â£46 million to make his transfer permanent also highlights the unfulfilled potential of his loan move to Old Trafford.
